question: How are greenhouse gas emissions calculated for subpart W (oil and natural gas systems) facilities?

The total annual emissions across fluorinated GHGs for the entire facility, in metric tons of CO2e, are calculated using the default GWP of 10,000. Furthermore, the emissions from production and transformation processes of fluorinated GHGs by fluorinated GHG group for the facility as a whole must be reported, with the exception of a major fluorinated GHG constituent of a fluorinated gas product, if applicable. The total GWP-weighted mass of all fluorinated GHGs in each group emitted from equipment leaks must also be reported in metric tons of CO2e.
